newsitem.title: FRANCE: French woman found dead in Algeria - paper.
newsitem.headline: French woman found dead in Algeria - paper.

text.p: The body of a murdered French woman has been found in a well in the Algerian village of Bouzeguene, 90 km (60 miles) east of Algiers, an Algerian newspaper said on Sunday.
The 55-year old woman, married to an Algerian, had regularly spent her holidays in the Berber village, said Liberte newspaper, quoting local residents. It said the woman was killed "some days ago".
Her suspected murderer had been arrested as he was trying to flee to neighbouring Libya, said the newspaper.
It was not clear whether the murder was linked to Algeria's political violence pitting Moslem guerrillas against the North African country's government.
About 60,000 people, including more than 100 foreigners, have died in the five and half years of strife. Most of the foreigners were French nationals.
